meanings.definition: To ride faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah was outriding her competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outride his friends when they go cycling together.
meanings.sent3: The little boy thought he was outriding a cheetah on his bike.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outride all obstacles in her path was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The image of the horse outriding the wind stayed with her long after the race.

meanings.definition: To surpass or excel in riding.
meanings.sent1: The skilled rider was outriding all others in the competition.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outride her fear and perform a perfect jump.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy's goal was to outride even the legendary rodeo champion.
meanings.sent4: His passion for outriding the waves on his surfboard was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The young jockey hoped to outride the older, more experienced racers.

meanings.definition: The act of riding outside or beyond a certain area.
meanings.sent1: Exploring the forest on horseback was his favorite outriding activity.
meanings.sent2: The outriding adventure took them through valleys and over hills.
meanings.sent3: The outriding group got lost in the wilderness but found their way back.
meanings.sent4: She enjoyed the freedom of outriding along the beach at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The outriding tour offered breathtaking views of the countryside.
